name: stereoscopically
content:
Add to word list

by looking at two slightly different views of something that the brain combines into one three-dimensional image (= having width, height, and depth): In aerial survey mapping, building heights are measured by viewing pairs of images stereoscopically. Coraline is the first stop-motion animation to be shot stereoscopically with a dual digital camera rig for digital 3D. Related word
stereoscopic
More examplesFewer examplesIt is possible to stereoscopically visualize the tumour spread beyond the bladder wall.Dental caries rates were observed macroscopically and stereoscopically.We hear stereophonically just as we see stereoscopically, and we underestimate the emotional flattening that occurs when we lose either the sight in one eye or the hearing in one ear.
